bwwExcerpt: Fey doesn't venture far from the outline of the original movie, in which new girl Cady (Erika Henningsen) falls in with a trio of divas led by queen bee Regina (Taylor Louderman), betraying herself and her other friends in the process. The musical numbers (by Fey's husband Jeff Richmond and Nell Benjamin) don't grow organically out of the story or characters, so much as feel padded on. (Talk about padding -- the movie was 97 minutes, this show runs a full hour longer.)
showScoreExcerpt:
"Perfectly harmless, wholly unnecessary...the very definition of disposable entertainment....Blown up to Broadway scale, none of this really works...The musical numbers don't grow organically out of the story or characters, so much as feel padded on...An already thin, lighthearted story seem painfully threadbare, and to drown out the story's central message about the importance of female unity...Which isn't necessarily to say that 'Mean Girls' is a chore to sit through."
